ratings.comment: I really liked her!  Even though I'm not a sociology major she was super helpful and made her lectures interactive and relatable.  People complained about her tests being hard, but I found them easy because I paid attention and PARTICIPATED in classes.  Totally a great class and well worth it

Angela was a wonderful teacher. Unbiased, and very interesting in hearing student's opinions and facilitating in-class discussion. Her material is thought provoking, and lectures are very engaging with a mix of powerpoint, videos, and discussion questions. If she doesn't get you to think about the world around you...not sure who will!

Not a very good lecturer.  She's entertaining but the material she talks about in class lacks content.  Really encourages class participation which is good because you hear some really stupid comments from students.  She has someone else grade the tests so you need to talk to her if you're unhappy with the grade.  Good job at being unbiased.

Enthusiastic and energetic teacher.  Very interesting subject matter.  1 quiz/ 1- page-paper per week, but no exams.   Pretty easy grading scale with manageable work load.  The reading is all scanned online but was usually not necessary anyways. She is still a grad-student, but very good.  Overall good class
The workload is manageable and she is enthusiastic and very helpful. Don't rely too heavily on sources in your papers or overuse quotes. She is more interested in your own opinion.

She is a great teacher and keeps the class fun and interesting. The class is a TON of work for a three credit class though... 60-100 pages of reading per week, a typed reading reponse paper due each Friday, a quiz each Monday, and two other large papers due. A lot of work, but still easy. Shes great though!

She's a great teacher, but she has changed her curriculum this semester.  We have to write three papers.  These weren't bad and her grader doesn't grade hard.  But she also requires 2 additional take home exams that are 5-8 pages...with 25 sources (from class material)...a little over board if you ask me. All in all, she's a good teacher!
Great!! She's so charismatic, and her method of teaching is wonderful. I learned so much more than I ever would have if there had been hard tests,etc.
Angela is awesome! She relates to all of her studetns and actually cares about you. If you have the opportunity, you should def go to her office hours! She's cool, fun and easy to talk to!

This is my favorite class! Angela totally breaks the stereotype of an intimidating and condescending teacher. She is constantly keeping us entertained by cracking nonstop jokes and keeps the material interesting. Class is really easy, only three big papers and readings.
Very intelligent, and down to earth. She isn't your average professor, very energetic and funny. She keeps the lectures interesting.
oh yeah, shes is yet another professor who ACTUALLY cares about her kids. she gets us and she tailors her lectures to us. shes amazing!
Great teacher! Cares about sociology and her students. She tries to mix things up in lecture which is fun! No tests, just papers. I would take her again for another class!

She was my TA for Soc 210 - she was very personable and very excited about Sociology.  She was quite clear with class expectations and was always willing to help outside of class - she made Soc 210 a pleasure to take.

Great teacher.  Very excited about what she's doing.  Only essays for tests and easy grader.  Lectures move quickly and lots of reading but she shows movies and stuff.  Very willing to help you if you need it.
